post_text:
The BCHS Fine Arts Awards Ceremony was an Awesome Display of the great talent we have here at BCHS! Thank you to all the Directors, Coaches, and Faculty that took part in the Presentation of the Awards.

A Special Thank You to Mitch Bennett for presenting the Fine Arts Supporter of the Year Award to Karen King! Karen we thank you to for all you have done for so many years. You are loved and appreciated by so many.
The video of the presentation to Karen King is attached in another post (the entire presentation will be uploaded at a later time). Thank you to everyone for your continued support and love of music in our community!

shared_text:
Ryan Patrick
April 17 at 12:10 PM ·

Tonight would have been our opening night. ⁣
⁣
We were halfway through our rehearsal schedule for The Addams Family when the world turned upside down. I am so proud of the work we did. And while the show will go on next year, it will do so with a much different look.⁣
⁣
To the seniors at BCHS, I’m so sorry that your family, friends, and community won’t have the opportunity to witness what I saw in rehearsals. You were just beginning to find the spirit and voice of your characters. You had put so much work into learning the songs and choreography. You were doing amazing work and it was getting better every day.⁣
⁣
I know it’s hard, but don’t get discouraged by this. Please keep going. Do more shows. Audition for bigger roles. Try some new things. You have so much to do and so much talent to share. ⁣
⁣
This is not the finale. It's simply an intermission. ⁣
⁣
Act Two is gonna be awesome. And I’ll be there to support you from the front row. ⁣

To the seniors at BCHS, I’m so sorry that your family, friends, and community won’t have the opportunity to witness what I saw in rehearsals. You were just beginning to find the spirit and voice of your characters. You had put so much work into learning the songs and choreography. I know it’s hard, but don’t get discouraged by this. Please keep going. Do more shows. Audition for bigger roles. Try some new things. You have so much to do and so much talent to share. ⁣

post_text: In addition to dropping off fundraiser items on Thursday between 4 and 6 p.m., we felt it was a good time to also turn in band uniforms. Please make sure all your components are included: INSIDE THE UNIFORM BAG - the bibber pants, the jacket and cape (percussion don't have a cape), and INSIDE THE HAT BOX - hat. Please keep your shoes with you. If you are a senior, you may choose to donate them for the cause, but you don't have to.

post_text:
AN IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT ABOUT COLLECTING THE LAST FUNDRAISER THAT WAS OUT WHEN THE SCHOOL CLOSURE WENT INTO PLACE: This Thursday, April 16th from 4:00-6:00pm, all candy bars, pretzels, and money need to be Dropped-Off at BCHS.
Drive Up to the teacher parking lot behind the Rich Herrin Gym (Boys Gym) - no need to get out of your car, and I will collect all items.
If you need music, equipment, or an instrument, please let me know before Thursday and I can have it ready for you at the Drop-Off.

Notes from the Ohio Trip Meeting can be found in Students' School Emails, Google Classroom, The Closed Group on Facebook for the BCHS Music Department, and the band app. The audio from the meeting in only sent via Student School Email Accounts.

First off, we miss seeing all of our students every day. We hope everyone is staying healthy and safe.

If you are in need of an instrument or music from the high school, we are happy to find a solution to get it to you while staying within our safety guidelines and protocol at this time.

Here is what I need from you, if you need anything....
Send a Message - requesting specifically what you need and where it is located. (we will contact you and go from there) Thank You - stay safe

post_text: Same.
shared_text:
Ryan Patrick
January 15 at 10:46 AM ·

There are some things I enjoy about Directing.

Casting is not one of them.

Gretchen Bennett and I had the unenviable task of casting ten principal roles out of a pool of 44 crazy-talented students.

Ten. Out of 44.

Whew.

I wish the cast could understand how difficult it is to make these decisions. I lose sleep over stuff like this.

But... we have a cast. And it's pretty great.

Come see The Addams Family at the Benton Civic Center April 17-19.

#snapsnap

(Special thanks to Annika Kolbo, Kady Lampley, Celia Summers, and Alisa Leffler for your assistance and input.)

But... we have a cast. And it's pretty great.

Come see The Addams Family at the Benton Civic Center April 17-19.

#snapsnap

(Special thanks to Annika Kolbo, Kady Lampley, Celia Summers, and Alisa Leffler for your assistance and input.)

Just a heads up....

Musical Auditions are Jan 13th (430pm-730pm) with Call Backs on Jan 14th (beginning at 430pm).
If you want a speaking part, you must have a memorized monologue prepared and read from the script; along with preparing a song. All others just need to sing. We will have a live accompanist, so bring sheet music.

Want to be invloved but not be on stage? No audition required, Just fill out a form.

post_text:
What a wonderful opening night for the 42nd Annual Madrigal Feast! I am so proud of all my students hard work, focus, dedication, perservance and willingness to share their talents with others.
Tomorrow is our final performance and there are only a couple of tickets left online. It is practically sold out, which is a GREAT problem to have. Unfortunately, there will not be any tickets available at the door.
Thank you to all of our supporters!

post_text:
We had an excellent set crew yesterday for Madrigals!

Next set crew is Sunday 4-830pm. We need all the parents we can have to help, also need: trucks, trailer, drills with Philips and star bits. We will have to move 23 full platforms, 6 orchestra platforms, 5 half platforms, 3 stair cases, the 4 castles walls, 2 castle doorways and side walls, and 200 cinder blocks. The goal on Sunday is to deliver the above mentioned hardware to the civic center and set it up, unload the enclosed trailer, and place and secure tables, benches and chairs. We will NOT decorate on Sunday.

Thank You to the parents helping brew the Wassail on Friday and then Saturday morning help pass it out at the school from 10-1130am.

Next rehearsal is Monday Nov 25th at the civic center and it includes the entire cast from 6-830pm. There is a set crew proceeding that from 330-530pm for wrapping up Sunday's project and to begin decorating the dais.

Please take advantage of NO REHEARSAL TONIGHT, and work on memorizing your lines. Everyone Should be off book on Tuesday.

post_text:
You all represented Benton Superbly today!
In the Southern District 6 ILMEA Music Festival: Jay was Ranked in the Top 10 Trumpets, Macy was Ranked within the Top 31 Soprano 1, Auria was Ranked within the Top 31 Soprano 2, Trey was Ranked within the Top 23 Tenor 1, and Evan was Ranked within the Top 23 Bass 2.
It was a very long day (16 hours), but a very rewarding day as well! Thank you for all your hard work.
State Results will be posted by the end of this month.

They will not announce state qualifiers until after all district festivals are completed. You must attend District to be eligible for state.

Trey Murphy
Macy Shelton
Jay Simmons
Auria Tessone

Pork Chops will still be grilled today, even if it rains. We have moved over to the AG building for pick up due to the pending weather.
Pick up is between 5-8pm.

The band students are to wear jeans, long sleeve shirt of any color, and shoes that don't matter if they get muddy. We will provide pink shirts tonight.

Our hopes is that it will stop raining around 6pm and the band will perform both pregame and halftime. If the weather changes those plans, I will keep you posted.

post_text:
Well, it is almost time for band camp this year!
Camp runs Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. with lunch provided.
Thursday Camp runs 3 p.m. to 6 p.m. followed by a performance at 6 p.m. in the Rich Herrin Gym.
Immediately following the 6 p.m. performance is a band party on the practice field that is open to the public as well. The Junior High bands have been invited to the performance and the party. The school staff has been invited as well. Please spread the word about this event. It is one way we can give back to the community for their continued support of our program.

This year we have a dunk tank, bounce house, racing ninja water obstacle course, slip and splash with dual slides, velcro wall, hoop vs. hoop, a battle lights competition, football, corn hole, snow cones, hot dogs, sodas and music.

We are in need of 12 parent volunteers to help run the picnic. Please let me know if you are able to help out. Thank you so much for making this happen for the kids.
text:
Well, it is almost time for band camp this year!
Camp runs Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. with lunch provided.
Thursday Camp runs 3 p.m. to 6 p.m. followed by a performance at 6 p.m. in the Rich Herrin Gym.
Immediately following the 6 p.m. performance is a band party on the practice field that is open to the public as well. The Junior High bands have been invited to the performance and the party. The school staff has been invited as well. Please spread the word about this event. It is one way we can give back to the community for their continued support of our program.

This year we have a dunk tank, bounce house, racing ninja water obstacle course, slip and splash with dual slides, velcro wall, hoop vs. hoop, a battle lights competition, football, corn hole, snow cones, hot dogs, sodas and music.

We are in need of 12 parent volunteers to help run the picnic. Please let me know if you are able to help out. Thank you so much for making this happen for the kids.

shared_text:
Susan Derry Summers‎Pyramid Players Community Theatre
April 26, 2019 at 6:54 AM ·

TOMORROW IS THE FIRST AUDITION DATE!
Hope to see lots of you at auditions for the Rodgers & Hammerstein classic "Carousel" we're presenting this summer at the Benton Civic Center! Two audition dates to choose from: Saturday, April 27, starting at 10 in the morning OR Monday, May 6, starting at 5 pm. Both auditions will be held at the Benton Middle School. Meet in the commons area. Bring a song (we encourage you to choose one that you are comfortable with), accompanist will be provided. Depending on your age, you may be asked to read from the script. This will be a multi-generational cast, so it's the perfect chance for families who want to do something memorable together. Those who have been involved in our shows typically comment that they love the friendships they develop over the summer and from year to year. We truly are a family and welcome newcomers! Please share this post with your friends/family. Thanks!

shared_text:
Tracey Brouillette Webb
April 5, 2019 at 5:06 PM ·

Hey, high school seniors planning to come to RLC in the fall: I just wanted to remind those actors out there that Rend Lake College offers Intro to Acting ONLY in the Fall semesters. If you are wanting to hone your acting skills in a lively, hands on type of class, sign up for THEA 1101 - Intro to Acting. It's worth three credits and will help you with shyness, memorization skills, and character believability. It's a good class for ANY major, not just Theatre. Contact me at 618-437-5321, Ext. 1295 or private message me. I am always looking for new talent!
